page.title: 17FARMING _ PROBLEMS
page.content: Potatoes are the main cash crop, although expensive to cultivate as they are labour intensive and the soil has to be fertilised. After harvesting the potatoes have to be sorted by hand before selling. Farmers face problems with potatoes such as drought and blight. The soil in the Vale consists mainly of broken down limestone. This causes it to be a strong alkaline soil and it has to be neutralised by the farmer. It is usually done with special machinery that can cope with the "up and down"landscape of the Vale's farmland.The areas of steep land of the Vale have lead to the reclamation of undergrowth and wooded areas. This expensive process is contracted out and the land is sown with Italian rye grass for two years.
